result.execSummary:
The defendant Bobby R Savage was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft-Intent. Take >$5000-$10,000 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court
Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Defendant IS Eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program and is NOT eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Probation may be transferred to the State of Michigan.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

No Contact with co-defendants or with any victims/witnesses/businesses listed in the criminal complaint. Provide a DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is imposed. Maintain employment and/or school combination. Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent. 
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Non-working hours. Release for standard conditions. Commencing forthwith. Sentence credit of 190 days were granted. Remaining sentence may be served in Michigan but Electronic Monitoring is NOT allowed.

records.addlTxt: Pretrial Incarceration sheet

Defendant Bobby R Savage in court, in custody, with Attorney Chris Bailey.   Abbey Nickolie and Law Intern Becky Van Dam appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for sentencing hearing. Attorney Bailey states/recites one correction to the presentence investigation.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Bailey makes statements regarding sentencing. Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #3:  IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

4 YEARS IMPRISONMENT 
  -  2 YEARS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  2 YEARS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON 

TERM OF PROBATION:  3 YEARS       **May be transferred to State of Michigan** 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____No contact with: Co-Defendant's or with victims/witnesses/business listed in criminal complaint
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 

COSTS:  $278.00 & $250.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of probation)

CONDITION TIME:  9 MONTHS (190 DAYS CREDIT), Non-working hours with standard release conditions to commence forthwith (Defendant alreay in custody). Remaining sentence may be served in Michigan but NO electronic monitoring allowed. 

Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program. 

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Character letter dated 11/19/14 (received today).
2 separate character letters received today. CC to DA and Atty Bailey.

3 separate character letters received on 11/06/14. CC to DA and Atty Bailey.

State requests a presentence investigation.  Court orders presentence investigation. Bail remains as fixed. Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 11, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
